section.title: Editing the documentation
section.para: First make sure you have the Bzr branch &branch;lp:xubuntu-docs and the build dependencies for &package;xubuntu-docs.
Changes to the user documentation should be made to the .xml files under user-docs/C/. Once edited and saved, push changes to your local branch as detailed in .
Similarly, changes to the contributor documentation should be made to the .xml files under contributor-docs/C/.

section.title: Notes on the contributor documentation
section.para: For various reasons, the contributor documentation is more complex in structure than the user documentation. Particularly, pay attention to the following when working with the subteam documentation:

listitem.para: If you want to create an introductory paragraph that is shown on the subteam main page, use the <simplesect> element. Otherwise this will be chunked into a separate HTML file. Note that this also removes the section from the Table of Contents.
If you want a subsection of a section to be visible in the Table of Contents, use the <sect1> element. For an actual example, see the qa-* files.

The sections are chunked up to the first level; this means all direct ascendants of <chapter> elements will be chunked into separate HTML files. If you want to avoid this (for example if your chapter is very short), insert the <?dbhtml stop-chunking?> after the <title> element of your chapter. Note that doing this will not stop the Table of Contents from being printed with each section; you might can use the <simplesect> element again to hide sections from the Table of Contents.
